ovdesc.p: The LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES file contains the financial information pertinent to all LOANS AND DEPOSITS & MONEY MARKET contracts. There is only one version of the record and it is established when a contract is first input and validated.
The information that this record contains can be classified into four main sections:
(i) Principal movements over the life of the contract.
All updates to this file are effected automatically by the system and the only functions users are allowed to perform are (L)IST, (S)EE and (P)RINT.

When a contract is written to history, either due to reversal or maturity, its LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES record is also written to history, although this may be "n" days after the reversal or maturity (as per field DAYS.POST.MATURITY on LMM.INSTALL.CONDS record).

desc.p: The cumulative principal that the customer has ever received on a contract. Used by payment routines to ensure that payments are not duplicated and consequently updated when payments are physically sent rather than 'accounted for'.

This field records the amounts sent to a customer either for drawdowns on asset contracts or for repayments on liability contracts. It is used to control the sending of 'principal' funds, ensuring that whatever part of the LD or MM module is used to send funds to a customer, money cannot be sent twice.

This field is not classified as a 'financial' field because firstly, it is often updated before the accounting entries for a payment are passed; and secondly, is purpose is one of control rather than providing financial information.

Each time interest is accrued on a contract, the LMM ACCOUNT BALANCES fields are updated (e.g. OUTS ACCRUED INT is debited on a placement contract) and an entry is posted to Profit and Loss (e.g. INTEREST RECEIVED is credited on a placement contract). The keys to the Category entry records produced in this accrual process are stored in this field.

It should be noted that it is only the Category entry numbers that relate to the current interest period that are held in this field. Previous interest period information is held on the LMM.SCHEDULES.PAST file.
Because one accrual period can have many Category Entries then this field will also accept sub values.
The key to the Category Entry file is made up of 2 parts, Statement Number and Sequence Number.
If a transaction generates several Entries, all the entries have the same Statement Number, the Entries on the same file are distinguished from each other by their Sequence Number.
The Statement Number consists of:

1. 4 digit date expressed as the number of days since 31st December 1967. 2. Time in seconds since midnight, consisting of 5 integers and (usually) 2 decimals. If the time is an exact number of seconds since midnight, the decimals are omitted.
The Sequence Number is a 4 digit number from 0001 to 9999.
Field 80.1 contains the Statement Number which is the first part of the key for all the Category Entries.
Field 80.3 contains the range of Sequence Numbers used for the Category Entries.

a) Field 80.1 - Statement Number 9 integers and (usually) 2 decimals. b) Field 80.2 - not applicable for category entries. c) Field 80.3 - range of Category Entry Sequence Numbers Up to 5 numeric characters with '-' after the first. (Internal file, no input.)

The outstanding accrued Commission on a fiduciary deposit contract, as of the last accrual date. Often called 'commission earnt not collected' and 'current commission receivable'. This field holds the balance of accrued commission, that has not yet been received, on a contract. The amount is correct up to the date of the last accrual which is the last value in DATE COM ACC TO (Field 66). Whenever an accrual is performed on a contract, the details of the commission calculation are recorded in Fields 63 to 66, and the result of the calculation added to this field. When this amount is null or zero it signifies that no accrual has yet been performed on the contract for the current commission period as shown in START PERIOD COM (Field 60) and END PERIOD COM (Field 61). i.e. no commission has been earnt (but not received from the customer) for the current period. When this amount is negative it signifies that at least one accrual has taken place in the current commission period and that this commission amount has been earnt (and recorded as profit) but has not been collected from the customer yet. This field can never be positive. Each time this field has an amount added to it (e.g. an accrual for $100, implying a debit of $100), then an entry is posted to profit and loss, commission received. (e.g. a credit of $100 to the profit and loss category code as input in field 29 on LMM.INSTALL.CONDS). To calculate the net commission outstanding on a contract (i.e. including pre-payments), this field should be added to OUTS OVER DUE COM (Field 15). It should be noted that the Money Market System only allows commission on fiduciary deposits and that fiduciary commission is only accrued when a commission rate has been input on the fiduciary contract. If an amount of fiduciary commission (but no rate) is present on the contract then no commission accruals will take place. Commission accruals will only take place when there is a value in the field FID COMM RATE on the contract.

NUMBER OF DAYS is the difference between START PERIOD INT and END PERIOD INT taking the various rules of INTEREST BASIS into account. . Discounted contracts will show the amount of interest paid/received at the start of the current interest period and will not change this field during the current interest period. This field has three main uses: 1. On the Confirmation of the deal to the customer, specifying the interest amount for the interest period. 2. As an internal piece of information such as a forecast of an interest movement across an account (FWD.ENTRY file). 3. As a check against rounding errors. e.g. Three days interest may compute 10 yet three daily accruals may calculate 9.99 (3 x 3.33). INT.AMT.TODATE

The amount of interest calculated using the components in this multivalue set of fields (fields 52 to 57). Whenever an interest accrual takes place, fields 52 to 57 inclusive are updated with the components used in the accrual calculation. These fields are PRINC INT BAL (the balance of principal on the Contract); AC INT RATE (the actual interest rate used in the calculation); AC INT SPREAD (the interest spread, if applicable); DATE INT ACC TO (the date interest is accrued to); and the resulting interest amount fields - INT AMT TODATE (rounded) and ACTUAL ACC AMT (not rounded). So as to keep a full history of the interest accrual during the current interest period, these fields are multivalue associated and each time one of the calculation components changes, a new set of values is added. This field, INT AMT TODATE, contains the result of the interest calculation, rounded according to the currency. It is signed negative for asset contracts and positive for liability contracts. An example of how this field and the other accrual fields are used is shown in the details of field 52, PRINC INT BAL.

AC.RATE

The set of fields from AC.FROM.DATE to AC.ACT.ACCR form an association containing interest accrual data. A new multivalue is created each time a month end is passed, or the principal or interest rate is changed. AC.RATE contains the rate at which interest accrues over the period. The other 6 fields are for date accrued to (AC.TO.DATE), number of days in the accrual period (AC.NO.DAYS), interest rate (AC.RATE), rounded accrued amount (AC.ACCR.AMT), and unrounded accrued amount (AC.ACT.ACCR). These 7 fields store data in reverse chronological order (the most recent being found in the first multivalue).
